column4: Hello, I am attempting to develop a USB application using libusb (cvs) on Ubuntu 6.06, kernel 2.6.15.7. Are there know problems with this combo? I get 'Operation not permitted' error messages.
what operation
libusb's 'make check' and others
why are you doing "make check" as libusb is already installed on ubuntu
libusb comes package for ubuntu
I believe the 6.06 libusb package is 0.1.12, which is obsolescent? I have installed libusb0.1.13 cvs, and am getting error with that
why
why I get the error is the question.
why do you need .13
Because from my readings about libusb, 0.1.12 is obsolescent, and appears not to have the commands to talk to devices. the cvs version does.
should do
Are you stating that Dapper Drake 6.06 comes with the LATEST libusb, with full documentation, all working?
no, I'm saying it comes with a stable packaged version which should be used for deployment on the 6.06 platform
OK. Well that fits. Its an old version. Maybe stabel, but lacks a lot of utility.
no point developing on later versions not shipped with ubuntu
does any later ubuntu version (than 6.06) have the later libusb version?
I believe so
waht ubuntu version has the later libusb version?
7.10 at a guess
